page.title: 01CARMARTHEN,A DESCRIPTION
page.content: Carmarthen is the administrative centre of Dyfed. It has a population of 14,000,it is 210 miles from London and 9 miles from the sea.Holiday traffic is heavy in summer time. Carmarthen is very old and dates from pre_Roman times.It was occupied by the Romans and later the Normans built a castle. A Franciscan Friary is now being excavated.Market day is Wednesday and cattle marts are held weekly. The town is very busy on these days.Carmarthen has a twin town in Brittany called Lesneven and many exchange visits have been made. The new bridge is named Pont Lesneven.Much road work has been done in recent years to provide new by pass facilities for the town.
